title: Document and annotate where admin routes are defined

requirements.summary: Keep admin route documentation accurate and add an in-code pointer comment near the admin route declarations in App.tsx referencing ADMIN_ROUTES.md.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md` explicitly states that admin routes are defined in `frontend/src/App.tsx` and lists the admin paths: `/admin/login` and `/admin`.
`frontend/src/App.tsx` includes a brief comment near the admin route declarations (the `createRoute` blocks for `/admin/login` and `/admin`) pointing maintainers to `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md`.

No changes are made to any files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or `frontend/src/components/ui`.

file_operations.description: Verify the documentation explicitly states that admin routes are defined in `frontend/src/App.tsx` and that it clearly lists the admin paths `/admin/login` and `/admin` (adjust wording/formatting for clarity while keeping the same paths).

Add a short pointer comment immediately adjacent to the admin `createRoute` declarations for `/admin/login` and `/admin` indicating that admin routes live here and referencing `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md` for maintainers.
